SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp

Class FTPConnectionMetadata

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp.FTPConnectionMetadata
public class FTPConnectionMetadata extends Object
Provides comprehensive metadata about an active FTP connection. This object is passed to FTPConnectionHandler methods to provide context for authentication decisions and file operations.

It includes network information, security status, authentication details, FTP protocol state, and connection lifecycle information.

Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Constructor Details

    • FTPConnectionMetadata

      public FTPConnectionMetadata(InetSocketAddress clientAddress, InetSocketAddress serverAddress, boolean secureConnection, Certificate[] clientCertificates, String cipherSuite, String protocolVersion, long connectionStartTimeMillis, String connectorDescription)
      Constructs a new FTPConnectionMetadata instance.
      Parameters:
      clientAddress - the remote client's socket address
      serverAddress - the local server's socket address
      secureConnection - true if the connection is currently secured with TLS/SSL
      clientCertificates - client X.509 certificates if mutual TLS is used, null otherwise
      cipherSuite - the TLS cipher suite in use, null if not secure
      protocolVersion - the TLS protocol version (e.g., "TLSv1.2"), null if not secure
      connectionStartTimeMillis - the timestamp when the connection was established
      connectorDescription - a description of the connector (e.g., "ftp", "ftps")

    • isStandardFTPPort

      public boolean isStandardFTPPort()
      Convenience method to check if the connection is on a standard FTP port (21).
      Returns:
      true if the server port is 21

    • isSecureFTPPort

      public boolean isSecureFTPPort()
      Convenience method to check if the connection is on a standard FTPS port (990).
      Returns:
      true if the server port is 990

    • setSiteCommandResponse

      public void setSiteCommandResponse(String response)
      Sets a custom response message for SITE commands.

      This allows handlers to provide multi-line responses for SITE commands like SITE QUOTA.

      Parameters:
      response - the response message (may contain newlines)

    • getSiteCommandResponse

      public String getSiteCommandResponse()
      Gets the custom SITE command response, if set.
      Returns:
      the response message, or null if not set
